title: beadboard.nvim — Neovim plugin for interactive beads management
description:
Neovim plugin providing full-window buffer-based UI for browsing,
viewing, and mutating beads via the bd CLI. All data access through
bd ... --json subprocess calls, vim-idiomatic keybindings.

## Success Criteria
- Users can browse beads in a list buffer with filtering/sorting
- Detail view shows all bead fields with inline mutation keybindings
- Text fields editable in scratch buffers that save back via bd update
- Search and structured query support from within Neovim
- Plugin is async, responsive, and follows fugitive/oil.nvim patterns

title: Phase 1: CLI wrapper + list buffer (read-only)
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] cli.lua: async subprocess execution via vim.system(), JSON parsing, error handling
- [ ] list.lua: render bd list --json into full-window scratch buffer
- [ ] Syntax highlighting for priority/status/type columns
- [ ] :Beadboard command registered, R to refresh list

title: Phase 2: Detail buffer (read-only)
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] detail.lua: render bd show <id> --json with comments and deps
- [ ] <CR> from list opens detail buffer, q/BS returns to list
- [ ] All bead fields rendered in readable markdown layout

title: Phase 3: List mutations
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Status cycling (s/S) via bd update --status
- [ ] Priority cycling (p/P) via bd update --priority
- [ ] Close (c), reopen (o), claim (K), create (C), delete (dd)
- [ ] Auto-refresh after each mutation

title: Phase 4: Detail mutations
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Same mutations as list buffer (status, priority, close, reopen, claim)
- [ ] Set assignee (a) via vim.ui.input + bd update --assignee
- [ ] Add/remove labels (l/L) via vim.ui.select
- [ ] Add comment (C-c) via vim.ui.input + bd comments add

title: Phase 5: Field editing
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ed/eD/en/ea/et keybindings open scratch buffer with current field content
- [ ] BufWriteCmd autocmd saves back via bd update --<field>
- [ ] Markdown filetype set for description/design/notes/acceptance buffers
- [ ] Detail buffer refreshes after save

title: Phase 6: Filtering, sorting, search
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] filter.lua state management for active filters
- [ ] f opens filter menu (status/type/priority/assignee/label), F clears all
- [ ] gs/gS for sort/reverse sort via vim.ui.select
- [ ] / for text search (bd search --json), q for query (bd query --json)
- [ ] Pagination with ]/[
- [ ] :BdSearch, :BdQuery, :BdReady, :BdBlocked commands

title: Phase 7: Polish and extras
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] ? help buffer listing all keybindings
- [ ] :BdStatus dashboard (bd status --json + bd count --by-*)
- [ ] Dependency navigation (gd/gp/gc) in detail buffer
- [ ] Assignee/label completion from bd count/label commands
- [ ] Optional statusline component showing bead counts

title: Explore: Neovim plugin for interactive beads viewer
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- Findings stored in bead design field (not filesystem)
- Structured as Current State, Recommendation, and phased Next Steps
- Each phase is independently actionable
- Covers bd CLI capabilities, proposed plugin architecture, and keybindings
design:
## Current State: bd CLI Capabilities (v0.49.6)

### Data Model
- **Core fields**: id, title, description, status, priority (P0-P4), issue_type, owner, assignee, labels, created_at, updated_at
- **Text fields** (editable via `bd edit <id> --<field>`): description, design, notes, acceptance, title
- **Statuses**: open, in_progress, blocked, deferred, closed
- **Types**: task, bug, feature, chore, epic + extended types
- **All commands support `--json`** for structured output

### Key Commands
- `bd list` — rich filtering (--status, --priority, --type, --assignee, --label, --sort, --limit, --ready, etc.)
- `bd show <id>` — single bead detail
- `bd search <q>` — full-text search
- `bd query "<expr>"` — structured query language (field=value, AND/OR/NOT)
- `bd update <id>` — mutate any field (--status, --priority, --assignee, --design, --notes, --claim, etc.)
- `bd edit <id>` — open field in $EDITOR (--design, --notes, --acceptance, --title)
- `bd close/reopen` — with optional --reason
- `bd comments add/list` — comment management
- `bd dep add/remove/list` — dependency management
- `bd ready/blocked/stale` — smart views
- `bd count --by-*` — grouped counts (status, priority, type, assignee, label)
- `bd status` — project summary

---

## Recommendation: beadboard.nvim

### Architecture
- All data via `bd ... --json` subprocess calls (async via `vim.system()`)
- Full-window scratch buffers, filetype-based keymaps
- Three buffer types: list, detail, edit
- Module structure: cli.lua, list.lua, detail.lua, edit.lua, filter.lua, highlight.lua, util.lua

### Buffer Types

**List Buffer** (`beadboard-list`): Table format — ID | Priority | Status | Type | Title
- `<CR>` open detail, `s`/`S` status, `p`/`P` priority, `c` close, `o` reopen
- `K` claim, `C` create, `dd` delete, `/` search, `f` filter, `q` query
- `R` refresh, `gs` sort, `?` help

**Detail Buffer** (`beadboard-detail`): Rendered markdown with all fields
- `q`/`<BS>` back, `ed/eD/en/ea/et` edit fields
- `s/S/p/P/a/l/L/c/o/K` mutations, `<C-c>` add comment
- `gd/gp/gc` dependency navigation

**Edit Buffer** (`beadboard-edit`): Scratch buffer with field content
- Pre-filled from JSON, saved via BufWriteCmd → `bd update`

### Commands
`:Beadboard`/`:Bd`, `:Bd <id>`, `:BdSearch`, `:BdQuery`, `:BdReady`, `:BdBlocked`, `:BdCreate`, `:BdStatus`

---

## Next Steps

**Phase 1: CLI Wrapper + List Buffer (read-only)**
1. cli.lua: async subprocess execution, JSON parsing, error handling
2. list.lua: render bd list --json into full-window scratch buffer
3. Syntax highlighting for priority/status/type columns
4. :Beadboard command, R to refresh

**Phase 2: Detail Buffer (read-only)**
5. detail.lua: render bd show <id> --json with comments and deps
6. <CR> from list opens detail, q/BS returns to list

**Phase 3: List Mutations**
7. Status cycling (s/S), priority cycling (p/P)
8. Close (c), reopen (o), claim (K), create (C), delete (dd)
9. Auto-refresh after mutations

**Phase 4: Detail Mutations**
10. Same mutations as list + assignee (a), labels (l/L), add comment (C-c)

**Phase 5: Field Editing**
11. ed/eD/en/ea/et keybindings open scratch buffer with field content
12. BufWriteCmd saves back via bd update, markdown filetype for editing

**Phase 6: Filtering, Sorting, Search**
13. filter.lua state management, f for filter menu, F to clear
14. gs/gS sort, / search, q query, pagination with ]/[
15. :BdSearch, :BdQuery, :BdReady, :BdBlocked commands

**Phase 7: Polish**
16. ? help buffer, :BdStatus dashboard, dependency navigation (gd/gp/gc)
17. Assignee/label completion, optional statusline component

description:

design:
## Current State

Full Neovim plugin at plugin/ + lua/beadboard/ (16 lua modules).
CLI wrapper pattern: every view calls `bd` CLI with --json, renders into scratch buffers.
Async by default via vim.system(). Per-buffer state keyed by buf handle.

### Config (3 options)
- bd_cmd (string, default 'bd')
- default_limit (number, default 50)
- default_sort (string, default 'priority')

### Commands (11)
Beadboard, BdSearch, BdQuery, BdReady, BdBlocked, BdStale, BdCreate, BdStatus, BdEpicStatus, BdGraph, BdActivity

### Keybindings
- List: 25+ normal, 4 visual (bulk ops)
- Detail: 35+ normal (edit, deps, navigation, status)
- Activity: 5 (CR, R, a=auto-refresh, q, ?)
- Graph: 4 (CR, R, q, ?)
- Edit: w=save, q=close

### Features
Filtering (12 dimensions), sorting (8 fields), bulk ops, create wizard,
epic progress bars, dependency graph, activity feed, dashboard, statusline,
telescope integration with fallback.

### Requirements
Neovim 0.10+, bd CLI, optional telescope.nvim

## Recommendation
Write comprehensive README covering install, config, commands, keybindings by view,
features, statusline, telescope, highlights.

## Next Steps
Phase 1: Write README
Phase 2: Review and iterate

title: beadboard.nvim: Full bd CLI coverage
description:
Extend beadboard.nvim to expose all high-value bd CLI functionality
that currently forces users to drop to the terminal. Covers rich
creation, dependency management, dynamic pickers, triage workflows,
graph visualization, bulk operations, and remaining commands.

## Success Criteria
- New issues can be created with all fields (type, priority, description, labels, assignee, parent) without leaving Neovim
- Dependencies can be added, removed, and visualized from within the plugin
- Type and label pickers are dynamically populated from bd CLI data
- Triage workflows (defer, stale, epic status) are accessible via keymaps/commands
- Dependency graph renders in a Neovim buffer with navigable issue links

title: Phase 1: Rich issue creation
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Multi-field create flow covering title, type, priority, description, assignee, labels, parent
- [ ] Types fetched dynamically from bd types --json
- [ ] Labels fetched from bd label list-all --json for picker
- [ ] C keymap in list buffer wired to new create flow
- [ ] :BdCreate user command available for direct invocation

title: Phase 2: Dependency management
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Detail keymaps: da (dep add), dr (dep remove), dR (dep relate), dU (dep unrelate)
- [ ] db shorthand for dep add --blocks
- [ ] Issue picker for target issue selection (not raw ID input)

title: Phase 3: Dynamic pickers and filter enhancements
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Hardcoded type list replaced with bd types --json throughout
- [ ] Label picker seeded from bd label list-all --json with free-text fallback
- [ ] Date-range filter support in filter.lua
- [ ] --all toggle for showing closed issues in list view
- [ ] --label-any and --empty-description filter options

title: Phase 4: Triage workflows
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] defer/undefer keymaps (gD/gU) in list and detail buffers with optional --until prompt
- [ ] :BdStale command with configurable --days parameter
- [ ] :BdEpicStatus command showing epic progress
- [ ] Due date and estimate editing in detail buffer
- [ ] Parent assignment/change via picker in detail buffer

title: Phase 5: Dependency graph view
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] graph.lua module rendering bd graph output in dedicated buffer
- [ ] gg keymap in detail buffer shows current issue's dependency graph
- [ ] :BdGraph and :BdGraph <id> user commands
- [ ] Navigation within graph buffer: CR on issue ID opens detail view

title: Phase 6: Bulk operations and fuzzy picker
description:
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Visual-mode selection in list buffer for bulk close/delete/defer/update
- [ ] Fuzzy issue picker module (vim.ui.select or telescope.nvim if available)

title: Phase 7: Activity feed and remaining commands
description:

- [ ] :BdActivity command rendering activity feed with optional auto-refresh

description:

design:
## 1. Current State

### bd CLI surface area

**Core CRUD:** create (full fields), update (any field), show (--refs/--thread/--children), close, reopen, delete, list (extensive filtering), search, query, comments, edit

**Dependencies & Structure:** dep add/remove/list/tree/cycles/relate/unrelate, children, graph (box/compact), duplicate/supersede, epic status/close-eligible

**Triage & Workflow:** ready, blocked, stale, defer/undefer, promote, rename, todo add/done/list, set-state/state, move/refile

**Views & Reports:** status, count (by-status/priority/type/assignee/label), activity (--follow), types, find-duplicates, duplicates, lint, label list-all

### Plugin currently implements

**Commands (6):** :Beadboard, :BdSearch, :BdQuery, :BdReady, :BdBlocked, :BdStatus

**List keymaps (17):** open detail, refresh, close, status cycle/pick, priority cycle, close, reopen, claim, create (title-only), delete, filter, clear filters, sort, search, query, help

**Detail keymaps (20):** close, refresh, status/priority cycle, close, reopen, claim, assignee, label add/remove, comment, edit desc/design/notes/acceptance/title, show deps, go parent, show children, help

**Create flow:** Title-only via vim.ui.input — no type/priority/description/parent/labels/assignee

### Gaps

**High-value (daily workflow):**
1. Rich create form (type, priority, description, assignee, labels, parent, due, estimate)
2. Dependency mutation (dep add/remove/relate/unrelate) — currently read-only
3. Dependency graph view
4. Type change keymap
5. Due date / estimate editing
6. Defer / undefer
7. Stale issues view
8. List filter gaps (date ranges, --label-any, --label-pattern, --all, --desc-contains, --empty-description, --no-assignee, --no-labels)
9. Parent assignment/change
10. Label autocomplete from bd label list-all
11. Dynamic type list from bd types --json
12. Epic status

**Medium-value (occasional):**
13. Rename
14. Duplicate / supersede
15. Promote (wisp to permanent)
16. Count by assignee/label in dashboard
17. TODO shortcuts
18. Activity feed
19. Bulk operations (multi-select close/delete/defer)
20. Telescope/fzf integration for issue picker

## 2. Recommendation

Prioritize by user friction — features that force dropping to terminal.
Create form is the biggest gap (every new issue needs terminal update).
Dependency mutation is second (core beads differentiator, read-only now).
Then dynamic pickers, triage workflows, graph view, bulk ops, remaining.

## 3. Next Steps

**Phase 1: Rich issue creation**
1. Multi-field create flow covering: title, type, priority, description, assignee, labels, parent
2. Fetch types from bd types --json, labels from bd label list-all --json for pickers
3. Wire C in list buffer to new create flow
4. Add :BdCreate user command

**Phase 2: Dependency management**
5. Detail keymaps: da (dep add), dr (dep remove), dR (dep relate), dU (dep unrelate)
6. db shorthand for dep add --blocks
7. Fuzzy picker for target issue selection

**Phase 3: Dynamic pickers and filter enhancements**
8. Replace hardcoded type list with bd types --json throughout
9. Label picker from bd label list-all --json
10. Date-range filter support in filter.lua
11. --all toggle for closed issues in list
12. --label-any and --empty-description filter options

**Phase 4: Triage workflows**
13. defer/undefer keymaps (gD/gU) in list and detail buffers
14. :BdStale command with configurable --days
15. :BdEpicStatus command
16. Due date and estimate editing in detail buffer
17. Parent assignment/change via picker

**Phase 5: Dependency graph view**
18. graph.lua module rendering bd graph output in buffer
19. gg keymap in detail buffer for current issue graph
20. :BdGraph command
21. Navigation within graph (CR on issue ID opens detail)

**Phase 6: Bulk operations and fuzzy picker**
22. Visual-mode selection in list for bulk close/delete/defer/update
23. Fuzzy issue picker module (vim.ui.select or telescope.nvim)
24. Wire picker into dep-add, parent-set, duplicate-of, supersede-with

**Phase 7: Activity feed and remaining**
25. :BdActivity command with optional auto-refresh
26. Rename action in detail buffer
27. duplicate --of and supersede --with actions
28. promote action for ephemeral issues
29. Dashboard with --by-assignee and --by-label breakdowns
